intro: Oenothera hookeri var. hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which help it conserve moisture in arid environments. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is known for its ability to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
